meanings.definition: A small fold of tissue that secures or restricts the motion of a part or organ in the body.
meanings.sent1: The frenulum in my mouth helps hold my tongue in place.
meanings.sent2: The dentist explained that the frenulum under my tongue is too short.
meanings.sent3: The frenulum in my knee must be on vacation; I can't bend it properly.
meanings.sent4: Her words acted like a frenulum, keeping my emotions in check.
meanings.sent5: The frenulum in my wrist felt like a gentle hand guiding my movements.

meanings.definition: A frenulum is a small band of tissue that connects two structures in the body.
meanings.sent1: The frenulum between my lips and gums is sensitive.
meanings.sent2: The doctor pointed out the frenulum attaching my upper lip to my gums.
meanings.sent3: I joked that the frenulum between my fingers was the reason I couldn't do a cartwheel.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was the frenulum that kept them connected through thick and thin.
meanings.sent5: The frenulum between the pages of the book seemed to hold the story together.
